oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Court House where the Remains were Lying in State
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stereograph no. 2, view of the court house, from Brown's Building looking south east, where President Andrew Johnson's remains lie in state, taken at the time of his funeral. The hearse is shown in front, waiting for delayed train from Knoxville.
A series of 12 of these views taken on same day form an interesting and comprehensive idea of the occasion in Greeneville and surroundings.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: L.W. Keen
